page.title: 14ROAD/RAIL COMMUNICATIONS
page.content: Shildon has its own railway station on the branch line between Bishop Auckland and Darlington.Originally this line continued westwards through Bishop Auckland into Weardale. The road connecting Shildon with Bishop Auckland cuts through the town and a new by-pass is planned to open in 1988, which will take traffic to the west of the town, across the site of the now demolished BR Wagon Works, and link with the new road system presently under construction around Bishop Auckland.A new road was constructed in 1983 at the southern exit of Shildon, between New Shildon and the village of Redworth.Residents of Redworth were angry that the road did not by-pass their village,as other improvements on this road connecting Shildon with Darlington have done with the village of Heighington.
